title: Public Funding Manager
description:
*Are you looking for a place where ambition meets real impact? Do you have a proven track record in securing public funding? Do you want real ownership, strategic influence, and the opportunity to evolve alongside a fast-growing start-up?*
*At Grale, an award-winning ClimateTech company revolutionizing sustainable alternatives to plastics, we’re now looking for an exceptional Public Funding Manager. Here you’ll have the freedom and support to grow - with the opportunity to shape your role, develop new skills, and advance your career as we scale globally.*
**Public Funding Manager**
 Grale develops next-generation sustainable alternatives designed to replace fossil-based plastics. As our Public Funding Manager, you will play a key role in securing public funding that supports Grale’s R&D, product development, and scale-up initiatives.
   

  

 Your mission is to own the execution of Grale’s public funding pipeline: from identifying the right grant opportunities to leading high-quality applications and managing awarded funding throughout its lifecycle. You will work at the intersection of advanced R&D and commercial scalability, ensuring that technical initiatives are matched with relevant national and international funding programs.
   

  

 Working closely with our founders, and technical teams, you will translate R&D and scale-up initiatives into competitive, well-structured grant applications while supporting Grale’s long-term growth.
   

  

 You will be the internal expert on public funding processes, requirements, and timelines - ensuring that Grale applies to the right programs, at the right time, with the right execution.
   

  

**Main responsibilities include, but are not limited to:**
* Identify, analyse, and apply for relevant public funding opportunities, including Swedish, EU and international grants, subsidies and innovation programs.
* Structure and scope complete grant applications based on Grale’s R&D, product development and scale-up initiatives, in close collaboration with the CTO and technical team.
* Lead the full grant application process end-to-end: from application planning and documentation to writing, budgeting, submission and follow-up.
* Write clear, compelling applications in collaboration with technical experts, articulating technical development, innovation, TRL progression, impact, and commercial relevance.
* Act as the main point of contact towards funding bodies and public authorities throughout the application and post-award process.
* Build and coordinate consortia for larger national, EU or international grants by engaging relevant research institutions, industry partners, and public actors when required.
* Manage the full grant lifecycle post-award, contributing to project setup including reporting, documentation, audits, milestone tracking and communication with funding bodies.
* Continuously improve Grale’s internal grant processes, templates, documentation and success rate.


**What you bring:**
* Proven experience working hands-on with documented track record in public funding, research grants, or large innovation programs (EU, national or international).
* Demonstrated experience writing and submitting successful grant applications.
* Strong understanding of funding bodies’ requirements, evaluation criteria, compliance rules, and reporting processes.
* Solid financial understanding, with the ability to contribute to budgets, cost structures, and resource planning within grant applications.
* Ability to understand and clearly communicate complex technical, scientific and commercial content.
* Exceptional writing skills in English (Swedish is very meritorious)
* Experience with consortium-based funding programs (EU or international) is highly meritorious.


**We also see that you:**
* Are comfortable working closely with technical teams and founders, translating defined initiatives into funded projects.
* Are highly structured, detail-oriented, and confident owning complex processes end-to-end.
* Enjoy working in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment.
* Are a self-starter with strong execution skills and follow-through.
* Are motivated by long-term impact, sustainability, and building something meaningful.


**What you get:**
* The chance to be part of a fast-growing startup making measurable environmental impact.
* Work alongside award-winning founders featured on Forbes 30 under 30 and awarded Prince Daniel Fellowship.
* A role with clear ownership and mandate within public funding execution.
* Beautiful, modern office in the heart of Stockholm.
* Free daily breakfast.
* Wellness grant + access to gym and health activities.
* Weekly afterworks and a collaborative, high-energy culture.
* Opportunities for professional and personal development.


*Imagine a world free from microplastics where our planet thrives. At Grale, we’re not just imagining it - we’re building it. Plastics are made from petroleum and remain in our environment for thousands of years, while microplastics have already found their way into our oceans, food, and even our bodies. By 2050, there could be more plastic than fish in the sea. We’re here to change that - and we’re looking for passionate people to join us.*
*🏆 Grale has been awarded as the World’s Most Innovative Sustainability Startup - selected from 1,400 companies globally*
*🥇 Ranked #13 on the Sifted 100: Fastest growing startups in the Nordics & Benelux 2025*
*🏆 Awarded Global Tech Innovator - selected among 2,000 technology companies worldwide*
**Interested?**
 We are interviewing continuously with the aim of filling the position as soon as possible. Apply today to join a team shaping a sustainable future 🌱
   

  

 Please note: We are not looking for assistance from recruitment agencies or external consultancies for this role.

title: Customer Service Representative for French market to Billerud (Part-time, 50%)
description:
**Job Description**
 Are you bilingual, fluent in English and French, and interested in working in an international environment? Would you enjoy a customer service coordinating position, giving excellent service? Do you want to be part of an exciting journey and work in Billerud's Customer Service team in Solna? This temporary position offers you to be a part of an international environment with focus on sustainability.
   

  

**About Billerud**
 Billerud is a global leader in superior paper and packaging materials crafted from virgin fiber, deeply committed to sustainability, quality, and customer value. Our innovative paper and packaging challenge conventional standards, aiming for a more sustainable future. With production units in Sweden, the USA, and Finland, and a global team of approximately 5800 employees, we serve customers in over 100 countries.
   

  

**Your Role**
 As a Customer Service Representative, you will play a main role in ensuring excellent customer service on a professional level. From managing customer orders to overseeing the order-to-cash process, you will be an integral part of our Customer Service team at Billerud in Solna.
   

  

**This is a temporary role covering 50% of a CSR position while it’s on parental leave for three months.**
**Responsibilities**
* Provide end-to-end customer service, from order placement to delivery and invoicing.
* Ensure the smooth flow of the order process.
* Coordinate inventory planning and domestic delivery from external terminals.
* Handle claims, export documents, and goods inspections to support customer import processes.


**Qualifications**
* Minimum 1 year work experience in a customer-related position
* Fluent in English and French, both spoken and written
* Fluency in other languages it’s a plus.
* Good knowledge in working within different IT-systems
* Bachelor’s degree of Science/Business Administration
* Experience of supply chain or/and logistics is a merit


 Personal qualities
   

  

 To thrive in this position, you should have a strong drive to evolve within the area of customer service and possess a proactive, problem-solving mentality. Your motivation to learn, take initiative, and build relationships with a service-oriented attitude will be key. Structured work style, prioritization skills, and a business focus are essential for success in this role.
   

  

 Our values are central in our business and we believe that you recognize yourself in:
 **We care for each other, and we do what we say.**
 Contact
   

  

 If you have any question about the position, please contact Recruiting Manager Giovanni Moya, Giovanni.Moya@billerud.com or HR contact Emma Dellmark, emma.dellmark@billerud.com
   

  

 Application information
   

  

 Start Date: As agreed upon
   

  

 Location: Solna, Sweden
   

  

 Salary: As agreed upon
   

  

 If you are ready for contributing to a global company's success story, we welcome your application. Join us at Billerud and be a part of a team dedicated to sustainable innovation
   

  

 Click here to apply for the job!
   

  

 Do you want to help create a sustainable future through your work?
   

  

 At Billerud, we are fully committed to reduce our and our customers carbon footprint by offering high-performance paper and packaging materials. We are convinced that the right solutions can be important tools to help fight climate change. That's why we see it as our responsibility to enable the best packaging choices, for a better tomorrow.
   

  

 Our proud history in the forestry and paper industry goes back more than 150 years. Since then, we’ve grown to what we are today: a world leading company in high-performing paper and packaging materials - passionately committed to sustainability, quality, and customer value. Our materials are the basis of packaging and paper products used by millions of people around the world, 24 hours a day, all year round.
   

  

 We serve customers in more than 100 countries through our three business areas Liquid Packaging Board, Paper and Paper Board. Our nine production units are located in Sweden, USA, and Finland and we have around 6,000 employees in 19 countries. Our annual turnover is approximately SEK 43.5 billion and the share is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. At Billerud we always put safety first, care for each other, and do what we say.
   

  

 Join us in redefining sustainable packaging and drive meaningful change for a better tomorrow.

title: People Business Partner
description:
We are looking for a new colleague to join Voyado as a People & Culture Business Partner to cover a maternity leave. This is an interim assignment from May 2026 to March 2027, where you’ll play a key role in supporting our continued growth.
 



  





 You’ll join a collaborative People & Culture team of four - three Business Partners and one People Generalist – and work closely with leaders and teams across the organization, with a primary focus on our Revenue organisation.
 



  





**About the role** 




 You’ll be a trusted advisor to leaders and a driving force in shaping our culture, ways of working, and people strategies. You’ll operate both strategically and hands-on, ensuring our people initiatives support business goals while creating an engaging, inclusive, and high-performing workplace as we continue to grow as a company.
 



  





**In this role, you will:** 



* Partner closely with leaders to align people strategies with business objectives, supporting growth, engagement, and performance
* Act as a trusted advisor to leaders, providing coaching and guidance on employee relations, conflict resolution, and workplace matters
* Support leaders through organizational change, offering advice on change management, communication, and implementation
* Develop and drive initiatives within talent management and career development, supporting continuous learning and professional growth
* Ensure a smooth and high-quality people experience for the Revenue organisation, covering onboarding, offboarding, compensation & benefits, compliance, and HR systems.
* Drive and maintain compliance across our international markets outside of Sweden, including Germany, the Netherlands, Denmark, and UK & Ireland
* Contribute to creating a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace where everyone feels valued, supported, and empowered



  





**So, who are you?** 




 You are a confident and trusted People Business Partner who takes pride in your profession and brings a strong business mindset. You enjoy working close to the business, translating goals into impactful people initiatives, and navigating change in fast-paced environments.
 



 You combine structure and clarity with a warm, proactive, and inclusive approach, and you’re motivated by enabling a positive culture and high-performing teams.
 



  





**Skills & Background** 



* A few years of experience as an HR/People Business Partner or in a similar strategic HR role, preferably within a fast-paced SaaS or tech environment
* Proven experience partnering with leaders to align people strategies with business goals, supporting both organizational growth and employee success
* Strong knowledge of talent management, employee relations, and organizational development
* Hands-on knowledge with core people operations such as onboarding, offboarding, compensation & benefits, and compliance, ensuring smooth and scalable processes
* A data-driven mindset, with experience using people insights and analytics to inform decisions



 Experience from high-growth, international environments, particularly supporting Revenue organizations, is considered a strong plus.
 



  





**What's in it for you?** 




 Voyado wouldn’t be the powerful platform it is without the people behind it. We really care for our Voyadoers, and some examples of what we can offer you are:
 


* An engaged team with a knowledge-sharing and friendly culture
* Summits where we hang out, workshop, discuss, and have a good time together
* Opportunities for personal and professional growth and learning in a dynamic and supportive environment
* Work-life balance – we don't have a long work-hours culture; we value engagement over hours worked
* An office-first but flexible hybrid working policy



  





 Some of our benefits:
 


* 30 days of vacation, so you can spend time on the things you love
* Breakfast buffet on Fridays
* A generous gadget-and-phone package (your choice!)
* 5000 SEK per year in wellness allowance
* A wellness hour you can use every week



  





**About Voyado** 




 Voyado is the ultimate solution for personalization and relevance across all channels—online and offline. Used by retailers and e-commerce companies worldwide, Voyado makes it possible for every brand to engage customers, elevate shopping experiences, and evolve their own businesses.
 



 We are now a company of 300+ colleagues on an exciting journey and have recently established a presence in new markets to strengthen our position in Europe. If you are ready for your next adventure and want to join our team on our expansion throughout Europe and have an interest in customer care, e-commerce, retail, and tech, let's get in touch!
 



  





**Be yourself 🏳️ 🌈** 




 At Voyado, we believe in gender equality. We are proud sponsors of Womengineer as well as Tjejer Kodar! Read more about Tjejer Kodar & Voyado here
 



  





 Equality is not only about gender but also about making everyone feel welcome and heard in a multicultural and diverse environment. We at Voyado strive to make everyone feel like they can bring their true self to work every day. Gender-equal and diverse teams have more perspectives on life and bring different ideas to the table, which in the end leads not only to making a better working environment but also a better product.
 



  





**Ready to find out more?** 




 Lovely! 🎉
 



 Before one applies, it can always feel like you need a better resume, more polish, or just another year of experience, but we say if you think this sounds like a place where you can shine, don't hesitate to send in your resume!
 



  





 We'd love to get to know you and understand what makes you tick, so write a few lines about what you enjoy about your current role and what would be an exciting challenge for you in the future. We are eager to get to know you and what you love to do, so be yourself and let your passion shine through in your application!

title: Senior Innovation Engineer
description:
**Introduction to Eficode**
 We’re building the future of software development - driving innovation across Cloud, DevOps, Agile, Service Management, and AI-powered transformation. Our mission is to help organizations evolve into truly software-driven enterprises, enabling them to deliver faster, smarter, and more sustainably. We believe in changing the world by sharing our expertise and enabling teams to work better through modern technology and intelligent automation.
   

  

 As an Atlassian Platinum Partner, we have been recognized multiple times as Atlassian Partner of the Year, most recently for 2024–25. We are also proud to be a two-time GitHub Partner of the Year in EMEA and an Azure Managed Service Provider. With over 600 experts across 10 countries, we bring together leading talent from the Nordics, continental Europe, the UK, and the Americas.
   

  

**Role purpose**
 In this role, you’ll be the technical driver in our innovation “lab” environment. You’ll take early-stage inputs - anything from high-level product vision to rough experimental code - and turn them into functional, well-structured systems that help us validate direction quickly.
   

  

 This is a highly hands-on role: you will spend the majority of your time building, iterating, and refining working software.
   

  

 Importantly, our prototypes are not meant to be disposable. Many of them mature into internal platforms, accelerators, or productized offerings - which means that some of them will require ongoing maintenance and improvements as they become used by others.
   

  

**Role Responsibilities**
*Your main responsibilities as our Senior Innovation Engineer will include (but won’t be limited to):*
* Build V0/V1 prototypes for new R&D initiatives, from concept to working implementation.
* Turn ambiguous inputs (vision, sketches, experimental snippets) into a coherent architecture and codebase.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to gather context early, clarify constraints, and move forward without waiting for perfect specs.
* Maintain a strong engineering baseline in prototypes: clean structure, pragmatic testing, and documentation so work can be continued.
* Support prototypes as they mature: fix issues, refine performance and usability, and improve maintainability when a prototype starts getting real users.
* Review innovation prototypes across the organization, mentoring teams to ensure solutions are grounded in sound engineering and business value


**Role Requirements**
*You will make a great match for this role if you have:*
* Have experience taking ideas from “early concept” to working prototypes/MVPs and iterating based on feedback.
* Are comfortable making architecture and engineering decisions: selecting stacks, defining boundaries/interfaces, and setting a maintainable foundation.
* Take ownership in ambiguous environments: you proactively align with stakeholders, ask the right questions, and drive work forward.
* Care about quality even in R&D contexts (pragmatic tests, clean code, CI/CD basics, and documentation).
* Are a team player: collaborative, supportive, and happy to share knowledge and help others succeed.
* Swedish language skills (at least basic) and fluency in English is needed.
* You must have full working rights in Sweden.


**Nice To Have’s**
*It would be an added bonus if you have:*
* Experience in R&D / innovation labs, internal product incubation, or consultancy-style delivery with shifting requirements.
* Cloud experience (AWS/Azure/GCP), containers, and modern runtime patterns (Docker/Kubernetes/serverless).
* Experience applying AI/LLM-enabled development in a pragmatic way to accelerate prototyping.
* Mentoring/technical leadership experience in code reviews and raising engineering quality across teams
* A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field - or equivalent practical experience.


**What’s in it for you?**
* Be part of a leading DevOps and Atlassian consulting company with over 600 experts across 10 countries
* Work with exciting customers across industries and tackle complex system implementation projects
* Grow your career in a learning driven culture with opportunities for training, certifications, and knowledge sharing
* Flexible working options with hybrid/remote work opportunities


**Sweden Benefits Include**
* 30 paid holiday days per year
* Healthcare allowance
* Parental salary cover
* Occupational pension and salary exchange options


 To find out more about life at Eficode, and hear what our people think about us, click here.
   

  

**Location**
 This position is hybrid in Stockholm, combining time at our Stockholm office with remote work.
   

  

***DEI Statement***
*At Eficode we are committed to offering an inclusive recruitment process and equal opportunities for all applicants. We are dedicated to creating a work environment that embraces diversity, inclusion, and respect for all employees. We believe that our differences make us better. We recognise that by having diverse perspectives, skills, ages, genders, backgrounds, and cultures, we will better drive our customers forward and innovate in our field.*
*To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from sharing unnecessary personal information or an image of yourself in your job application.*
***Salary Development***
*At Eficode, we believe your compensation should reflect the impact you make and how you grow along the way. Your salary develops through regular check-ins with your team lead, where we look at things like your skills, experience, client work, feedback, and overall contribution — both to your projects and to our culture. As a consultancy, it’s natural that factors like time spent on billable client work are part of the picture — but so are your development, collaboration, and everyday efforts that drive value. We also carry out a company-wide salary review once a year.*
*On top of your salary, we offer a broad mix of benefits, both financial and non-financial, to support your well-being, work-life balance, and professional growth.*
*Find out more about our benefits [* 
*here* 
*].*
***Beware of recruitment scams***
*Eficode never asks for payment, bank details, or sensitive personal information during the recruitment process. We only communicate through official Eficode email accounts and approved recruitment platforms. If you receive an unsolicited message, job offer, or request for personal or financial information claiming to be from Eficode, it may be fraudulent.*

title: Legal Counsel - Commercial Team
description:
**About Us**
 Legora is on a mission: to redefine how legal work gets done. From the very start we have been very clear about the fact that we are not building a solution for lawyers, we are building it with them, because it is the only way to make sure it gets done the right way; working side-by-side every step of the way.
   

  

 Our AI-native workspace empowers legal professionals not just to work faster - but to ask better questions, unlock new insights. Every day, we push the boundaries of legal tech to make complex processes smarter, faster, and more human. From thousands of documents analysed in minutes to intelligent workflows designed in collaboration with leading practices, we’re turning possibility into reality.
   

  

 Today we are trusted by global firms like Cleary Gottlieb, Goodwin, Bird & Bird and Linklaters in over 40 countries, but we have no plans on stopping here. We ship fast, we iterate effectively, and we scale rapidly - not by accident, but by design.
   

  

 When you join Legora, you become part of a team that believes "good enough" isn’t good enough and that the way to win is together, by empowering lawyers to do their best work with technology that truly understands them. If you’re excited by building from first principles, working with exceptional people, and accelerating change in a high-stakes, high-impact domain—then this is the moment and the place.
   

  

**We’re not just shaping the future of legal tech — we’re defining it. Ready to join us in building the intelligent future of law?**
**The role**
 As a Commercial Counsel in Legora’s Stockholm office, you will play a central role in supporting one of the fastest-growing legal technology companies globally. You will work closely with our commercial teams, advising on a broad range of matters with a primary focus on drafting and negotiating commercial contracts.
   

  

 This role requires a high degree of independence and the ability to operate across multiple time zones, partnering closely with stakeholders to enable deals while managing risk. You will report to the Head of Legal, based at our Stockholm headquarters.
   

  

 Legora’s legal function is a forward-deployed, AI-first team working across multiple jurisdictions and legal disciplines. We act as trusted partners to the business, with particular focus on product development, operations, and commercial initiatives. Beyond strong legal judgment, we value curiosity, problem-solving, and a proactive mindset — looking for pragmatic solutions as we help redefine how legal work is done globally.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Act as a commercial legal partner to the business, working closely with senior stakeholders in Growth, Operations, and Procurement on customer and supplier engagements.
* Lead the drafting, review, and negotiation of customer and supplier contracts, with a strong focus on closing deals efficiently and pragmatically.
* Advise on commercial risk allocation, pricing structures, liability, and contractual protections within customer and supplier agreements. Support go-to-market and procurement activities by enabling scalable, repeatable commercial contracting practices.
* Address data protection and compliance considerations primarily within the context of customer and supplier contracts, ensuring risks are appropriately managed without slowing execution.
* Develop and maintain commercial templates, playbooks, and guidelines to standardise negotiations and improve deal velocity.


**Who You Are**
* Law degree (LL.M. or equivalent) from Sweden, the UK, or an EU-jurisdiction, qualified to practice in that country.
* Proficiency in both spoken and written Swedish and English. Additional language skills are meritorious.
* 3-5 years of experience at a top-tier law firm and/or as an in-house legal counsel.
* Strong experience negotiating B2B SaaS agreements and supporting commercial teams. You’re an excellent negotiator.
* Strong legal judgment and confidence in making decisions independently.
* Experience in handling corporate matters and drafting and negotiating complex commercial agreements.
* Experience with data privacy matters, IT security and/or corporate law is meritorious.
* Your focus is on achieving meaningful business outcomes, translating into actionable advice delivered clearly and comprehensively.
* You thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic entrepreneurial environment and rapidly evolving business setting. You take initiative and are committed to delivering high-quality results. You are comfortable working independently and can effectively manage work across different time zones.
* You are excited about the potential of technology to transform the legal industry. You have a keen interest in AI and legal tech, and you are eager to learn and apply these tools in real-world settings.
* Please send your application in English and a copy of your university transcript in order for us to review your application fairly.


**Legora is an Equal Opportunity Employer**
 At Legora, we believe great teams are built on diversity of thought and experience. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and committed to creating an inclusive, high-performance culture where everyone can do their best work. We welcome people of all backgrounds and don’t discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Senior Software Engineer – Computer Vision & Tracking
description:
*Our client develops a cutting-edge, real-time golf ball tracking system using computer vision, image processing, and physical modeling. Deployed in over 1,000 golf facilities globally, this system operates under diverse real-world conditions.* 




  





**About the role** 




 This hands-on position involves deep technical contributions and close collaboration within our client's 5-engineer Tracking Core team. You will be instrumental in continuously improving an advanced real-time tracking system deployed globally, leveraging computer vision and physical modeling.
 



  





**You are offered** 




 An opportunity to work hands‑on with large‑scale, real‑time tracking technology used at over a thousand sites worldwide. You’ll join a skilled and collaborative team, tackle complex technical challenges, and contribute directly to improving a system that operates in demanding real‑world conditions.
 



  





**Work tasks** 



* Develop and maintain components of the real-time tracking system.
* Analyze performance of tracking algorithms using data from production installations.
* Implement and validate system improvements in production environments.
* Actively participate in discussions, code reviews, and collaborative problem-solving.
* Understand interactions with local servers, camera hardware, and network configurations.



  





**We are looking for** 



* Minimum 5 years of relevant experience in a similar role
* Advanced knowledge in C++
* Good knowledge in Python
* Experience with Linux-based environments
* Experience with object tracking systems, computer vision, or image processing
* Strong teamwork and ability to take shared responsibility



  





**It is meritorious if you have** 



* Experience with Rust
* Experience with embedded Linux or edge devices



  





**To succeed in the role, your personal skills are:** 



* Stable
* Responsible
* Intellectually curious
* Respectful



  





**Our recruitment process** 




 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 



  





 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.

title: Hybrid Strategist (Planning and Social Strategy)
description:
**Job Description**
**McCann Nordics**
**Hybrid Strategist (planning and social strategy)**
**Stockholm - minimum 3 days a week in our McCann offices in Stockholm**
 About McCann Nordics McCann Nordics is more than an advertising agency. We’re the Nordic arm of a global creative network, known for shaping culture and delivering measurable business impact for some of the world’s most ambitious and innovative brands.
   

  

 We’re now looking for a Hybrid Strategist (planning and social strategy) to join our Nordic team in Stockholm.
   

  

**The Role**
 You’ll work with major global brands across multiple categories, leading the strategic work across the Nordic region for a variety of global clients. This role requires a true hybrid profile: someone equally strong in traditional planning as in social strategy.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Lead and drive strategic work across all channels, for the entire Nordic region
* Collaborate closely with local teams and the broader McCann global network
* Build strong, trusted relationships with clients and key internal stakeholders
* Identify and proactively pursue new creative and business opportunities
* Balance high-level conceptual thinking with hands-on execution


**What We’re Looking For**
* Proven experience of planning and social strategy for clients - within an agency setting
* Mandatory experience working with global clients; fintech experience is a strong advantage
* A business-minded perspective, with a solid understanding of agency and client economics
* Fluent in Swedish and English (spoken and written); other Nordic languages are a plus
* Agile and creative, yet structured and calm under pressure
* Team-oriented, pragmatic, and skilled at navigating complex, multi-layered stakeholder environments
* Strong delivery focus and a results-driven mindset


**What’s In It For You**
* Growth & Impact: Play a key role in the continued expansion of McCann’s Nordic operations
* Global Collaboration: Work alongside top-tier talent locally and across our international network
* Competitive Package: Attractive salary and benefits
* Flexible Working: A hybrid work model that supports work–life balance

title: Market Access & Tender Manager
description:
*With its beginnings in a family run pharmacy in Correggio, Italy in the 1920s, Recordati is now a global pharmaceutical company, listed on the Italian stock exchange, with over 4,500 employees and turnover of over Euro 2bn.
   

  

 We are a group of like-minded, passionate individuals who go to extraordinary lengths for our patients, customers, partners, investors and the people across the globe who we serve. We develop and commercialise medicines to serve people living with common diseases, as well as those living with some of the rarest, in around 150 countries.
   

  

 At Recordati, our mantra is simple. We’ve always believed that health, and the opportunity to live life to the fullest, is a right, not a privilege. Whether that is for common diseases or the rarest – we want to give people the opportunity to be the best version of themselves.
   

  

 This drive will never stop. Together, we will always be reimagining tomorrow – with new ideas, new technologies and new innovations to fight diseases.
   

  

 Recordati. Unlocking the full potential of life.*
**Job Purpose**
 The Market Access Manager is responsible for enabling and optimizing Value and Access in Nordics-Baltics of our company’s pharmaceutical medicines to patients/citizens throughout the product life cycle. In this role, you will demonstrate the value of launch and portfolio assets by leveraging Health Economics and Outcomes Research (HEOR) to support market access strategies. You will collaborate closely with internal and external stakeholders to bring our products to market and effectively communicate the value proposition of our medicines.
   

  

 This role is reporting to the General Manager and works in close collaboration with the Medical and commercial department, the Global Value & Access department and external consultants.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Responsible for the HTA, pricing and access strategies for launch and inline products.
* In-depth review of current and future products to ensure all routes for access are maximized.
* Responsible for contracting with Regions and Hospitals
* Develop and lead the execution of the value demonstration and market access plans for Recordati Rare Diseases Nordics-Baltics
* Responsible for strategic preparation, timely submission and follow-up of the HTA and reimbursement dossiers.
* Oversee the full process of providing patient access to our innovations in Nordics-Baltics, including the maintenance of the current HTA, pricing, reimbursement and access status
* Lead the local evidence gaps and evidence generation process as it pertains to Market Access needs
* Lead the development or adaption of local economic models (budget impact, cost effectiveness)
* Responsible for pricing & reimbursement negotiations with authorities in collaboration with Senior region Management


**Required Education**
* University degree (eg Health Economics, Economics, Business Administration, Pharmacy, Medicine, Public Health) .


**Required Skills And Experience**
 Minimum 5 years of experience in a market access position.
   

  

 Experience in the pharmaceutical industry, dedicated consulting or a healthcare organization is an asset;
   

  

 Experience with price and reimbursement management or experience collaborating strongly with HEOR and/or Market Access (medical, marketing…) with good knowledge of price and reimbursement processes / rules/ regulations in Nordics-Baltics
   

  

 Experience with industry regulations & ethical codes within Nordics-Baltics;
   

  

**Technical Competencies**
**Required Behaviours And Competencies**
 Strong market access network skills and strong insight of the market access environment and key customers;
   

  

 Strong interest in health policies and the healthcare system;
   

  

 Ability to understand and interpret complex clinical and product trial data
   

  

 Strong oral and written communication skills in either Swedish or Danish and excellent skills in English
   

  

 Ability to generate innovative ideas/ solutions
   

  

 Entrepreneural mindset
   

  

 Clear focus for influencing and negotiating with access stakeholders
   

  

 Strong collaborative mindset
   

  

**Required Languages**
 Fluent in both written and spoken English
   

  

**Travel required in %**
*At Recordati we believe in people! Inspired by our purpose - unlocking the full potential of life - we are committed to creating a diverse environment and cultivating a culture of inclusion. We strive to continually lead with our values and beliefs, enabling our employees to bring their whole selves to work and develop their potential.*
*We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We recruit, develop and reward without regard to, amongst others, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, physical or mental ability, race, ethnicity, political or religious belief.*
*If you are looking to join a company where you can try new things, speak openly, and be bold, we invite you to apply today.*

title: People Business Partner
description:
*Vill du vara med och driva People-agendan i en av våra mest affärskritiska enheter? Hos oss får du chansen att arbeta nära ledningen inom Digital & IT, och tillsammans med ett engagerat team av People Business Partners skapa skillnad för verksamheten. Här får du både strategiskt och operativt ansvar, och möjligheten att påverka utvecklingen i en spännande tech-miljö. Välkommen till en roll där din kompetens och initiativkraft verkligen gör avtryck!*
**Om jobbet**
 Som vikarierande People Business Partner hos oss får du ett övergripande ansvar för att driva och utveckla People-agendan inom Digital & IT. Du arbetar både strategiskt, taktiskt och operativt för att säkerställa att people-processer och initiativ bidrar till våra affärsmål. Du är en affärsnära partner till chefer och ledare, tolkar verksamhetens behov och initierar proaktiva people-lösningar. Du integrerar people-strategier med affärsplaner och skapar förutsättningar för långsiktig utveckling. Du ingår i Digital & IT:s ledningsgrupp och samarbetar nära med kollegor i teamet People Business Partners. Tjänsten är ett vikariat mellan mars och oktober.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer vara bland annat:
   

  

* Stötta chefer i frågor som rör organisationsutveckling, workforce planning, ledarskap, talangutveckling, prestation och kompensation
* Hantera facklig samverkan/förhandlingar, arbetsrätt, rehabilitering och personalärenden
* Leda affärsteam inom P&C med representanter från olika avdelningar
* Genomföra och följa upp våra årliga HR-processer
* Använda HR‑data och analyser för att ge insikter och beslutsstöd till chefer samt delta i utveckling och implementering av HR‑processer och rutiner


 Följande kommer göra dig framgångsrik i denna tjänst:
   

  

* Relevant akademisk utbildning inom HR, personalvetenskap eller liknande
* Bred kompetens inom HR samt minst 5 års erfarenhet i liknande roll
* Erfarenhet av HR-arbete inom tech; från tech-bolag eller tech-enhet i ett större företag
* Van att driva HR-agendan självständigt med starkt affärsfokus
* Trygghet i arbetsrättsliga frågor och vana att leda förändringsprocesser
* Mycket god förståelse för utmaningar och möjligheter inom tech-branschen, såsom workforce planning, talangattraktion och förändringsledning
* Kommunicerar obehindrat på svenska och engelska


 Meriterande är även om du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med lean-agil utvecklingsverksamhet i tågstruktur eller liknande


 Som person har du en stark affärsförståelse och helhetssyn, och kan snabbt sätta dig in i verksamhetens mål för att koppla people-strategier till affärsutveckling. Du är självgående, tar initiativ och ansvar för att driva processer och projekt framåt, och trivs med att arbeta både operativt och strategiskt. Din proaktivitet och förmåga att utmana både dig själv och organisationen gör att du levererar resultat. Du är trygg i att stötta chefer i komplexa people-frågor, har lätt för att bygga förtroende och engagemang genom god samarbetsförmåga och relationsskapande, och är van att driva förändringsinitiativ.
   

  

**Kontaktuppgifter:**
 Rekryterande chef: anna.moren@lansforsakringar.se
   

  

 Facklig representant Forena: susanne.hirsch2@lansforsakringar.se
   

  

 Facklig representant Akademikerföreningen: anna.sandqvist@lansforsakringar.se
   

  

*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
 Länsförsäkringar AB är en inkluderande arbetsplats där mod, möjligheter och engagemang står i centrum. Vi erbjuder ett hållbart arbetsliv med flexibla villkor och satsar på att alla medarbetare ska kunna växa och trivas, oavsett bakgrund. Genom självstyrande agila team och fokus på kundernas behov utvecklar vi innovativa tekniska lösningar och skapar framtidens kundupplevelse.
   

  

 Hos oss värdesätts samarbete, öppenhet och mångfald, och vi tror att olika perspektiv är nyckeln till lärande och innovation. Vi ger dig tryggheten att vara modig, bidra med nya idéer och påverka både din egen och företagets utveckling.

title: Senior Sales Manager
description:
**Senior Sales Manager – (C&I BESS & EV Charging Infrastructure)** 




**Location:** 
 Sweden
 



  





 Are you energized by opening new markets and building strong customer relationships? Do you want to play a key role in accelerating the green energy transition across Sweden? Join us at Pixii as our new Senior Sales Manager - driving growth, shaping strategy, and delivering advanced energy storage solutions that make a real impact.
 



  





 Please submit your application no later than
 **February 27.** 




  





**Why Pixii?** 




 At Pixii, we’re not just building advanced technology - we’re powering a global shift towards cleaner, more reliable, and more flexible energy solutions. Our modular systems are transforming how homes, businesses, and communities access and manage energy. Based in Norway with a growing global presence, we’re helping clients worldwide accelerate the shift to a fully electrified and sustainable future.
 



 What sets us apart is our unique company culture. We’re passionate, driven, and maybe just a little impatient – we know the world needs greener solutions, and we’re here to deliver them fast. We’re not just colleagues, we’re often friends. We test, we sometimes stumble, we learn, and we grow – together. And yes, we have a lot of fun doing it.
 



  





**About the Role** 




 Pixii is seeking a commercially driven Senior Sales Manager to build and scale our Swedish presence across both the commercial & industrial (C&I) and EV charging infrastructure markets. You will drive new business, manage key accounts, and develop integrated solutions combining BESS with a variety of C&I and EV charging use cases.
 



 This position is ideal for a senior “hunter” who thrives in opening new markets, shaping customer strategy, and converting complex technical solutions into long‑term commercial success. You will operate with high autonomy and full ownership of the Swedish sales function.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




*Business Development & Market Expansion* 



* Develop and grow the Swedish market for modular BESS across commercial & industrial applications (e.g., peak shaving, load management, energy cost optimization).
* Identify and convert opportunities within EV charging infrastructure – including depot charging, fleet electrification, public charging networks, and behind-the-meter charging solutions.
* Build a strong sales pipeline spanning C&I customers, charge point operators (CPOs), fleet operators, integrators, EPCs, and developers.
* Leverage an existing network to accelerate deal flow and shorten sales cycles across both C&I and EV markets.



*Key Account Management* 



* Develop and manage strategic accounts across both C&I energy users and EV charging ecosystem players.
* Act as the primary commercial interface for key accounts, coordinating closely with technical and project delivery teams.
* Promote cross‑selling opportunities by positioning Pixii’s modular BESS platform across multiple sites, applications, and customer segments.



*Sales Execution* 



* Own the full sales cycle – from lead generation, solution scoping, and technical positioning to commercial negotiation and contract completion.
* Translate customer requirements into robust, technically and commercially optimized solutions in collaboration with Pixii’s engineering teams.
* Structure and negotiate complex contracts with a focus on long‑term value creation and healthy commercial margins.



*Market Intelligence & Representation* 



* Monitor and communicate market trends across both C&I energy management and EV charging infrastructure, including pricing, competitors, regulation, and policy.
* Represent Pixii at industry events, customer meetings, and partner forums spanning the Swedish/Nordic energy and EV ecosystem.



  





**Required Qualifications & Experience** 



* 5+ years of proven sales experience in BESS, EV charging infrastructure, power electronics, or related energy technologies.
* Track record in business development and closing high‑value B2B deals within commercial & industrial energy users and/or EV charging operators.
* Strong technical and commercial understanding of BESS solutions, C&I applications, and EV charging requirements.
* Established network within the Nordic and Swedish energy and EV infrastructure market (e.g., CPOs, fleet operators, developers, EPCs, integrators, utilities).
* Proficiency with CRM tools (preferably HubSpot) for pipeline management, forecasting, and sales reporting.
* Ability to work independently and entrepreneurially, with ownership of targets, pipeline, and customer outcomes.
* Experience managing long sales cycles in complex, solution-based environments.
* Excellent communication, stakeholder engagement, and negotiation skills.
* Fluent in Swedish, written and oral.



  





**Desirable Experience** 



* Experience selling combined BESS + EV charging solutions or C&I behind‑the‑meter energy systems.
* Understanding of Swedish grid constraints, DNO requirements, grid connections, and flexibility markets.
* Background in fast‑growing, technology‑focused, or international energy companies.



  





**What We Offer** 



* A senior, high‑autonomy commercial role shaping the Swedish market for C&I and EV‑integrated BESS.
* Opportunity to build a portfolio and leave a tangible commercial footprint.
* Competitive compensation with solid pension and insurance benefits.
* Access to advanced, modular BESS technology with strong technical differentiation.
* An agile international organization with short decision paths and high impact potential.



  





**Ready to make an impact?** 




 At Pixii, we believe that diversity makes us stronger. We’re dedicated to creating an inclusive workplace where everyone feels welcome and has the opportunity to thrive. If you're passionate and eager to learn, we encourage you to apply – even if you don’t meet every single requirement.
 



  





 For any questions, feel free to reach out to Simen Kortgaard, simen.kortgaard@pixii.com. Please note that, due to GDPR regulations, we can only accept applications submitted through our recruitment system. To apply, please use the link provided.
 



  





 All inquiries will be handled confidentially. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis.

title: Upphandlare med juridisk bakgrund till Försvarshögskolan
description:
Om arbetsplatsen
   

  

 Avdelningen för lokalförsörjning, registratur och inköp (ALRI) är en del av Försvarshögskolans verksamhetsstöd och samordnar högskolans stöd- och servicefunktioner. Vid avdelningen finns Försvarshögskolans högskolejurist som handlägger förvaltnings- och högskolejuridiska ärenden. Här finns också arkiv och registratur samt förvaltning av styr- och stöddokument. I avdelningen ingår sektionerna lokalförsörjning och inköp.
   

  

 Inköpssektionen söker nu en upphandlare. Sektionen består av fyra personer som samordnar och projektleder de upphandlingar och avrop som genomförs på högskolan samt handlägger samtliga inköp som genomförs. Sektionen stödjer också verksamheten i ett antal frågor så som e-handel, upphandling, affärsjuridik och avtal. Anställningen är placerad i Stockholm.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 Som upphandlare är du en viktig medarbetare i myndighetens centraliserade anskaffningsprocess och arbetar med upphandling och inköp i enlighet med gällande upphandlingslagstiftning. Du kommer självständigt att planera, genomföra samt följa upp upphandlingar som drivs i projektform med dig som projektledare. Du ansvarar för hela affärsprocessen från den inledande behovs- och marknadsanalysen fram till att avtalet tecknas och implementeras i verksamheten. Som upphandlare arbetar du även med avtals- och kvalitetsuppföljning.
   

  

 Utöver att genomföra upphandlingar kommer du även agera rådgivande vid direktupphandlingar som genomförs av verksamheten, du kommer även stödja inköparen och kvalitetsgranska inköpsprocessen samt hantera övriga löpande frågeställningar kring upphandling och inköp. I rollen som upphandlare ingår det även administrativt arbete samt att hålla utbildningar internt inom upphandlings- och avtalsområdet.
   

  

 Vem söker vi?
   

  

**Vi Söker Dig Som Har**
* Juristexamen eller eller motsvarande akademisk utbildning som vi bedömer som likvärdig.
* Minst ett års dokumenterad arbetserfarenhet av att självständigt genomföra upphandlingar enligt LOU av varor och tjänster inom offentlig sektor.
* Erfarenhet av att hantera begäran om utlämningar av allmänna handlingar kopplat till upphandling.
* Mycket goda kommunikationsfärdigheter i tal och skrift på svenska och i engelska.
* Goda kunskaper i Microsoft 365-programmen eller MS Office, inklusive Powerpoint, Excel och


 Word.
   

  

**Meriterande Är Erfarenhet Av**
* Att arbeta med säkerhetsskyddade upphandlingar (SUA).
* Upphandlingsarbete av varor och tjänster inom IT-området.
* Liknade arbetsuppgifter vid högskola eller universitet.
* Statistiska underlag relaterade till inköpsprocesser, till exempel spendanalyser.
* Att hålla i utbildningar/kompetenshöjande insatser.
* Arbete i E-avrop.
* Arbeta med e-handel och/eller kategoristyrning.


 Ovan erfarenhet ska kunna styrkas skriftligen genom intyg eller liknande.
   

  

 Personliga egenskaper
   

  

 Vi kommer att lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper och söker dig som är självgående som person och som tar ansvar för att driva dina arbetsuppgifter framåt med fokus på resultat. Du har ett gott omdöme och gör välgrundade avvägningar i både beslut och prioriteringar.
   

  

 Vidare har du en god problemlösande analysförmåga som gör att du kan hantera komplexa frågeställningar och identifiera relevanta lösningar. Du arbetar strukturerat och målinriktat och håller tidsramar samt har en mycket god administrativ förmåga. Därtill har du också en god samarbetsförmåga och kommunicerar tydligt och lyhört. Vi värdesätter ett prestigelöst förhållningssätt då tjänsten innebär en stor mängd interna och externa kontakter.
   

  

 För att trivas hos oss behöver du vara en engagerad och närvarande individ som vill bidra till Försvarshögskolans professionella utveckling, kollegiala samarbetskultur och sociala sammanhållning. Det faller sig naturligt för dig att dela med dig av din kunskap och bidra till att skapa en givande och god arbetsmiljö.
   

  

 Om anställningen
   

  

 Anställningen är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid (100%) som inleds med sex månaders provanställning.
   

  

 Anställningen är placerad i säkerhetsklass vilket förutsätter godkänd säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll.
   

  

 Anställningen kan komma att innefatta krigsplacering. Om du redan är krigsplacerad i din nuvarande anställning på en myndighet och din kompetens behövs i Försvarshögskolans krigsorganisation sker det en förhandling mellan berörd myndighet och Försvarshögskolan om var du ska vara placerad.
   

  

 Tillträde
   

  

 Enligt överenskommelse. Vi kommer löpande att kalla till intervjuer.
   

  

 Lön och förmåner
   

  

 Försvarshögskolan tillämpar individuell lönesättning.
   

  

 Förmåner för anställda vid Försvarshögskolan - FHS/Förmåner/anställd.
   

  

 Ansökan
   

  

 Ansökan ska innehålla ett CV samt personligt brev och skickas in via Försvarshögskolans
   

  

 rekryteringssystem genom att klicka på länken ”Logga in och sök jobbet” på annonssidan. Märk din ansökan med HR 25/2026. Din ansökan ska vara tillhanda senast 27 februari 2026.
   

  

 Komplett ansökan ska vara Försvarshögskolan tillhanda senast sista ansökningsdagen vid midnatt, CET/ CEST (Central European Time/Central European Summer Time).
   

  

 I de fall det inte råder en jämn könsbalans kan Försvarshögskolan vid lika eller i stort sätt lika kvalifikationer hos de sökande anställa den av underrepresenterat kön.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan senast 27 februari 2026!

title: Vårdenhetschef till Onkologiska mottagningen för bröstcancer, Södersjukhuset
description:
**Beskrivning** 




 Onkologiska kliniken på Södersjukhuset är en komplett onkologisk verksamhet med tre onkologiska mottagningar, medicinsk behandling, strålbehandling, slutenvårdsavdelning, ärftlighetsmottagning samt klinisk forskningsenhet. Kliniken består av cirka 170 medarbetare och är främst inriktad mot onkologisk behandling av bröstcancer, prostatacancer och kolorektalcancer.
 



 Vårt mål är att bedriva individanpassad och modern cancervård med hög kvalitet och starkt patientfokus. Verksamheten vill präglas av gott teamarbete och smidiga och säkra patientflöden.
 



 Mottagningen är en del av Bröstcentrum där även kirurgi, mammografi och patologi ingår. Arbetet sker i nära samverkan genom multidisciplinära konferenser.
 



**Arbetsuppgifter** 




 Som vårdenhetschef för Onkologiska mottagningen för bröstcancer har du ansvar för personalledning, arbetsmiljö, ekonomi och kvalitet med utgångspunkt i ett personcentrerat arbetssätt. Du är förstalinjenchef för enhetsledare, sjuksköterskor och undersköterskor, totalt 12 medarbetare. Du har även ett samordnande ansvar för klinikens ärftlighetsmottagning.
 



 Du leder och utvecklar verksamheten tillsammans med medarbetare, enhetsledare, övriga vårdenhetschefer, läkarchefer och medicinskt ledningsansvarig läkare i linje med verksamhetens mål. Uppdraget innebär att stödja medarbetarna i det dagliga arbetet, driva förbättrings- och utvecklingsarbete samt säkerställa ett systematiskt arbete med kvalitet och patientsäkerhet.
 



 Du ingår i Onkologiska klinikens ledningsgrupp och som stöd i uppdraget finns controller, HR-partner, verksamhetsutvecklare och IT-samordnare. Södersjukhuset erbjuder även ett chefsprogram med relevanta utbildningar.
 



**Kvalifikationer** 




 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper. Du är trygg och tydlig i din ledarroll, har ett starkt engagemang för patienten, är fokuserad på ständig förbättring och har en god samarbetsförmåga. Förmåga att prioritera, planera, inspirera och engagera medarbetare i ditt arbete är också mycket viktig. Du har god organisatorisk förmåga och ett helhetsperspektiv på verksamheten. Du delar Södersjukhusets ledar- och medarbetarsyn och arbetar:
 


* **Samarbetande** 
 genom att skapa goda relationer på individ-, grupp- och organisationsnivå
* **Kommunikativ** 
 genom förmåga att bygga förtroendefulla relationer genom öppen, respektfull och tydlig kommunikation
* **Förändringsredo** 
 genom att initiera och bidra till utveckling samt följa beslutade förändringar
* **Tillförlitligt** 
 genom att ta ansvar för ditt uppdrag och bidra till gemensam måluppfyllelse



**Krav** 



* Legitimerad sjuksköterska, gärna med specialistutbildning inom onkologi
* Tidigare chefserfarenhet eller erfarenhet av ledande uppdrag



**Meriterande** 



* Utbildning inom ledarskap och/eller verksamhetsutveckling
* Erfarenhet av cancervård eller annan högspecialiserad vård
* Erfarenhet av att leda forskning eller utvecklingsarbete



**Vi erbjuder** 




 Hos oss får du ett utvecklande och hållbart chefsuppdrag i en kunskapsintensiv verksamhet. Vi erbjuder bland annat chefsintroduktionsprogram, kompetensutveckling, friskvårdsbidrag, personalgym samt föräldrapenningtillägg.
 



**Övrigt** 




 Södersjukhuset tillämpar kontroll i belastningsregistret före beslut om anställning. Ansökan ska innehålla CV och examensbevis. Intervjuer sker löpande.
 



**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!** 



 När du söker jobb hos Region Stockholm behandlar vi personuppgifter som du lämnar i din ansökan, exempelvis kontaktuppgifter, CV och andra relevanta dokument. Uppgifterna används för att kunna hantera rekryteringsprocessen och bedöma din ansökan.
   

  

  

  

 Vi följer dataskyddsförordningen (GDPR) och har rutiner för att skydda dina uppgifter. I vissa fall kan personuppgifter komma att behandlas i tredje land (utanför EU/EES), exempelvis om vi använder tjänsteleverantörer med system eller servrar placerade där. Vid sådan behandling säkerställer vi att lämpliga skyddsåtgärder finns, till exempel genom standardavtalsklausuler eller andra godkända mekanismer.
   

  

  

  

 Mer information om hur vi behandlar personuppgifter och dina rättigheter hittar du i vår integritetspolicy.
   

  

  

  

  

  

 Södersjukhuset är ett av Nordens största akutsjukhus, vi finns i hjärtat av samhället, dag som natt för våra patienter. Hos oss står akutsjukvården i centrum och utgör tillsammans med de stora folksjukdomarna vår specialitet. Vi bedriver omfattande klinisk forskning och utbildning, för oss är det viktigt att kombinera det stora sjukhusets möjligheter med den nära och personliga patientkontakten. På Södersjukhuset är alla en del i en större helhet där vi tillsammans skapar morgondagens vård.
   

  

  

  


 När du söker jobb hos Region Stockholm behandlar vi personuppgifter som du lämnar i din ansökan, exempelvis kontaktuppgifter, CV och andra relevanta dokument. Uppgifterna används för att kunna hantera rekryteringsprocessen och bedöma din ansökan.
   

  

  

  

 Vi följer dataskyddsförordningen (GDPR) och har rutiner för att skydda dina uppgifter. I vissa fall kan personuppgifter komma att behandlas i tredje land (utanför EU/EES), exempelvis om vi använder tjänsteleverantörer med system eller servrar placerade där. Vid sådan behandling säkerställer vi att lämpliga skyddsåtgärder finns, till exempel genom standardavtalsklausuler eller andra godkända mekanismer.
   

  

  

  

 Mer information om hur vi behandlar personuppgifter och dina rättigheter hittar du i vår integritetspolicy.
   

  

  

  

  

  

 Södersjukhuset är ett av Nordens största akutsjukhus, vi finns i hjärtat av samhället, dag som natt för våra patienter. Hos oss står akutsjukvården i centrum och utgör tillsammans med de stora folksjukdomarna vår specialitet. Vi bedriver omfattande klinisk forskning och utbildning, för oss är det viktigt att kombinera det stora sjukhusets möjligheter med den nära och personliga patientkontakten. På Södersjukhuset är alla en del i en större helhet där vi tillsammans skapar morgondagens vård.
   

  

  

  





****Att söka jobb i Region Stockholm****



  


 Vi eftersträvar jämställdhet och jämlikhet på vår arbetsplats och ser gärna sökande med olika bakgrund och förutsättningar.
 


  


 Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via detta system. Ansök genom att klicka på knappen ”Ansök”. Ansökningar per brev eller e-post beaktas inte. Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt säljare av ytterligare jobbannonser.
 


  


 Vårt rekryteringssystem kan inte hantera anonyma ansökningar eller sökande med skyddade personuppgifter. Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ber vi dig att kontakta den kontaktpersonen som finns angiven i annonsen. Din ansökan kommer då att hanteras utanför rekryteringssystemet. Du bör även vara försiktig med vilken information du lämnar i din ansökan och endast ta med information som är relevant för den aktuella befattningen.
 


  


 Region Stockholm ansvarar för hälso- och sjukvård, kollektivtrafik, regional utveckling och bidrar till kulturlivet. Varje dag, dygnet runt. I landets snabbaste växande region. Tillsammans skapar vi Europas attraktivaste storstadsregion.
 


  


 Läs mer om hur det är att jobba hos oss i Region Stockholm

title: Accounts Payable Manager
description:
**Interim Reskontrachef AP, Stockholm** 




  





 Meritmind söker för kunds räkning en interim reskontrachef (AP) som vill leda och utveckla en nordisk AP-organisation i förändring. Bolaget är verksamt i ett tiotal länder och har en öppen, rådgivande och stödjande företagskultur med fokus på samarbete över landsgränser. Organisationen präglas av självständighet och ansvarstagande. Huvudkontoret ligger i Solna. Uppdraget startar så snart som möjligt och pågår till slutet av augusti.
 



  





**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter** 



* Administrativ chef för 9 medarbetare i Norden (inkl ansvar för utvecklingssamtal och lönerevisioner) samt outsourcad SSC i Indien.
* Daglig stöttning i löpande AP-arbete.
* Drivande i modernisering av processer inom P2P/AP.
* Deltagande i IT-projekt, exempelvis ny lösning för leverantörsfakturor för att möta lagkrav samt förbättringsprojekt.
* Ansvar för interna kontroller och leverantörsmasterdata.



  





**Kvalifikationer och erfarenhet** 




 Vi söker dig som är en erfaren och trygg ledare med gedigen kunskap i hela P2P/AP-processen. Du har dokumenterad erfarenhet av att leda team i internationell miljö (engelska och är van vid effektiviseringsprojekt inom AP, SSC som exempelvis systemimplementationer och kravställning. Det är en fördel om du har tidigare erfarenhet av SAP, Rillion, Basware och SAP workflow.
 



  





**Din profil** 




 Vi söker en proaktiv och lösningsorienterad person med kommunikativ och pedagogisk förmåga. Man bör trivas i en roll där man ska driva förändring samt vara en trygg och engagerad ledare som bygger förtroende och bidrar till en inkluderande och positiv teamkultur.
 



  





**I detta konsultuppdrag samarbetar kunden med Meritmind** 




 Meritmind är Sveriges ledande konsult- och rekryteringsbolag inom ekonomiområdet. Med ett stort nätverk av skarpa ekonomikonsulter och träffsäkra rekryteringar hjälper Meritmind människor och företag att lyckas inom ekonomiområdet varje dag. 25 års erfarenhet har gjort oss till en ledstjärna – för verksamheter i behov av expertis och för ekonomer som värdesätter utveckling och omtanke. Från våra kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö, Uppsala, Linköping, Västerås och Jönköping sysselsätter vi 400 personer och verkar över hela Sverige.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 För mer information om konsultuppdraget är du välkommen att kontakta ansvarig konsultchef.
 



 Intervjuer och urval kommer att ske löpande, så skicka gärna din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Se till att namn och kontaktuppgifter finns med i ditt CV och det är endast möjligt att bifoga ett dokument.
 



 Meritmind arbetar kompetensbaserat för att främja en objektiv och icke-diskriminerande konsultprocess.
 



  





**Tänk på detta innan du skickar in din ansökan (i enlighet med GDPR-lagstiftningen)** 




 Din ansökan ska ej innehålla personuppgifter kring civilstatus, familjesituation/barn, etniskt ursprung, ålder, politiska åsikter, religiös eller filosofisk övertygelse, medlemskap i fackförening, hälsa eller sexuell läggning.
 



**Välkommen med din ansökan!**

title: Director of Total Rewards
description:
**Description**
*Position at LeoVegas Group*
**About The Role**
 The Director of Total Rewards will be responsible for building and leading the global total rewards function from the ground up. This includes defining the strategic roadmap, designing core frameworks and processes, and start establishing a capable global team covering Compensation, Payroll, HRIS, and People Analytics.
   

  

 As a newly created leadership role, the Director will play a pivotal part in shaping how the company rewards, recognizes, and supports its people, ensuring competitiveness, compliance, and alignment with business priorities. This is both a strategic design and hands-on implementation position requiring strong transformation leadership.
   

  

 YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:
   

  

* Strategic Function Build
+ Develop a 1-3 year total rewards strategy & plan aligned to business goals and the company’s global people strategy.
+ Define and articulate the vision, scope, structure, and operating model for the Total Rewards function.
+ Build the C&B leadership team and establish global governance, frameworks, and ways of working.
+ Partner closely with CHRO and HR Leadership Team to embed the total rewards philosophy across the organization.


* Compensation Strategy & Design
+ Review and improve the job architecture, grading, and global compensation frameworks.
+ Review and improve the variable pay, and recognition programs that balance global consistency and local flexibility.
+ Lead global market benchmarking and develop compensation governance, policies, and decision rights.
+ Support executive reward design-suggesting STI & LTIs.
+ Evaluate and rationalize existing benefits offerings across regions; define a global benefits philosophy.


* Payroll & HRIS Integration
+ Assess current payroll operations and identify consolidation or outsourcing opportunities.
+ Implement standardized, compliant, and efficient global payroll processes.
+ Partner with Finance and IT to ensure accurate payroll accounting and data governance.
+ Oversee the implementation and optimization of HRIS systems.


* People Analytics
+ Define and implement a people analytics framework to enable data-driven workforce insights.
+ Establish dashboards, KPIs, and governance for workforce reporting and analytics.
+ Build capability for predictive analytics and support strategic workforce planning.


* Governance & Compliance
+ Ensure global compliance with employment, pay equity, tax, and data protection laws (GDPR).
+ Partner with Legal, Finance, and HRBP teams to ensure robust audit readiness and transparency.


 OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING:
   

  

* Master’s Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business, Finance, or a related field.
* 12+ years of progressive experience in Compensation & Benefits/Rewards, with at least 5 years in a senior leadership role in a multinational context.
* Proven track record in building or transforming a global total rewards function.
* Experience leading multiple disciplines: Compensation, Payroll, HRIS, and People Analytics.
* Strong background in developing frameworks, policies, and governance structures.
* Experience collaborating with executive leadership.
* Strategic, pragmatic, and hands-on, able to operate at both design and execution levels.
* Strong business and financial acumen; skilled in translating data into insights and strategy.
* Excellent communication, influencing, and stakeholder management skills across cultures and functions.
* Proven ability to build and lead teams through change.
* Integrity, discretion, and high professional standards in all aspects.


**Who We Are**
 At the core of LeoVegas Group is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 2000 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 19 offices worldwide.
   

  

**Benefits**
* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enrol in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.


 JOIN US!
   

  

 In our pride, we empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait for things to happen; we pounce and make it happen!
   

  

 Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!
   

  

 \*\*As our company working language is English, we’d like to see your CV in English, please\*\*

title: Senior Credit Analyst – German Market
description:
**Shape the future of consumer credit in Germany**
 What if your work could influence how consumer credit is done in one of Europe’s most competitive markets?
   

  

 At Anyfin, we’re building fairer and more transparent financial services for millions of people and Germany is our next big chapter. It’s the market that will define our growth, our product evolution, and how we make credit decisions for years ahead. To succeed, we’re looking for a Senior Credit Analyst who knows the German consumer credit landscape deeply and is excited to work hands-on, build real products, and see the immediate impact of their decisions.
   

  

 This is a rare opportunity to join a fast-moving fintech where credit is truly core to the business, where your German market expertise will directly shape how we operate, and where you’ll influence everything from underwriting flows to pricing logic. If you’ve been waiting for a role where your experience genuinely matters, this is it.
   

  

**Why this role matters**
 Germany is becoming one of Anyfin’s most strategic markets and your work will sit at the centre of that growth. The decision rules you design will influence thousands of lending decisions every month. The bureau strategy you shape will determine how we onboard customers. The pricing logic you refine will affect profitability and long-term performance. And the insights you bring from the German market will help us understand not just how to operate but how to win.
   

  

 This isn’t a back-office position. It’s a build-the-engine-with-us role where your decisions directly shape customer outcomes, risk quality and business results.
   

  

**What You’ll Work On**
 In this role, you’ll take ownership of improving and operating our German credit engine. You will work hands-on with automated decisioning: designing, refining and optimising the logic behind approvals, segmentation and pricing. You will help shape the German application flow and deciding what information matters, which bureaus to use and how different data sources should interact.
   

  

 You’ll bring German market nuance into our risk methodologies and collaborate closely with Data Science on scorecard structure and deployment. Beyond underwriting, you will work with pricing to optimise risk-adjusted returns and customer experience, and you’ll help improve servicing processes such as reminders, statements and payment flows. You will also support decisions around external partners and continuously monitor portfolio performance to turn insights into action.
   

  

 You’ll see the impact of your work quickly and iterate fast.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You’re someone who understands how German consumer credit actually works operationally, not only in theory. You bring hands-on experience from German consumer credit risk and a strong understanding of the local lending landscape, bureaus and risk drivers. You’ve worked with unsecured lending - loans, instalments or credit cards - and you feel at home in automated decisioning environments where rules and logic drive outcomes.
   

  

 You enjoy analytical work, feel comfortable with tools such as SQL or Excel, and bring a solid understanding of German consumer credit regulation. You’re fluent in both German and English and enjoy collaborating with product, tech, data science and other credit colleagues. Above all, you’re someone who likes to take ownership, solve end-to-end problems and build rather than maintain.
   

  

**Why relocate to Stockholm?**
 Because this is where the magic happens. You’ll be close to the product teams, the credit engine, the data scientists and the decision-makers — and you’ll play a central role in shaping how we launch and scale Germany.
   

  

 Stockholm is one of Europe’s most vibrant tech hubs: international, creative and easy to settle in, surrounded by water, forests and a high quality of life. And yes — we support your relocation.
   

  

**Why join Anyfin?**
 You’ll join a high-ambition fintech scaleup where credit is not an afterthought but a core part of the product. Your expertise will have real influence, and you’ll work in a culture built on curiosity, ownership and continuous learning. This is your chance to shape a market that truly matters for our future — and build something that lasts.
   

  

**Ready to shape the future of credit in Germany?**
 Apply and join us in Stockholm.
   

  

 Let’s build the next chapter of Anyfin together.
   

  

 Anyfin is a fintech on a mission to simplify loan repayments and improve the financial well-being of millions. We help consumers reduce the costs of high-interest loans, and take control of their repayment plan.

title: Senior Node.js Engineer - Group CMS
description:
**Description**
*Position at LeoVegas Group*
**About The Role**
 We are looking for a self-driven Senior Node.js to join the LeoVegas CMS team. Working within an agile environment, your primary focus will be the delivery of key features and improvements, writing clean, maintainable code that aligns with our broader architectural vision. As a senior member of the team, you will balance this delivery work with mentorship, helping to elevate our collective engineering standards through active collaboration and code review.
   

  

 You will be working on our proprietary headless CMS, a Node.js application that serves as the central content hub for the LeoVegas Group portfolio. The system relies on an event-driven, service-oriented, architecture to synchronise over 400,000 pages. Hosted within a GCP environment and managed via a single monorepo, the platform offers a mature, containerised context where you can focus on building scalable, full stack, code.
   

  

 YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:
   

  

* Developing features for the Group CMS
* Creating reusable modules across the Group CMS domain within NPM Workspaces & Turbo monorepo setup.
* Maintaining K8S manifests as Application Engineers within a company-wide platform provided by Platform Engineers
* Monitoring deployments with Grafana & Datadog
* Maintaining CI/CD automations with Jenkins & GitHub Actions
* Documenting proposals and decisions of a technical nature (RFC/ADR)
* Fostering a collaborative team culture through mentorship, knowledge sharing, and active support of your peers.


 OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING:
   

  

**Essential Skills**
* Proficient knowledge of JavaScript and Typescript, being able to converse comfortably with topics like JS internals, Typing, Code quality etc.
* Experience in NodeJS
* Experience in object-oriented programming
* Experience with writing APIs, RESTful and GraphQL
* Proficient understanding of code versioning tools
* Experience writing Unit Tests


 NICE TO HAVES
   

  

* Experience with NestJS

* Experience with ReactJS, NextJS, CSS and HTML

 At the core of LeoVegas Group is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry.
