Professional Galaxy is looking for a **Packaging Engineer - Primary packaging of pharmaceuticals** on behalf of our client.

**Job summary**  

Packaging Engineer – Pharmaceutical Development  

We are looking for an experienced Packaging Engineer to support pharmaceutical product development across a broad portfolio, with a strong focus on oral solid dose (OSD) primary packaging. This role is part of a technical development environment covering the full product lifecycle – from early development and clinical supply to scale-up and technology transfer.  

  

**The Role**  

In this role, you will lead and support packaging development activities within pharmaceutical development projects. You will work closely with cross‑functional teams and external partners to ensure robust, compliant, and sustainable packaging solutions.  

  

**Required Technical Skills & Experience :**  

Bachelor’s degree in Packaging Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or a closely related technical field (or equivalent experience)  

Broad understanding of pharmaceutical primary packaging principles, including materials, design, testing, and validation. Please note that experience from primary packaging material is required.  

Experience from packaging development and design tools  

Experience from qualification and validation of packaging materials  

Experience from pharmaceutical primary packaging regulations and testing requirements  

Experience from technical transfer of products and processes

**Other Information :**

**Assignment Duration :** 2026-04-01 till Open

**Remote work :** Yes

**Assignment length :** 6 month with option for extension is possible

 **Application Deadline** : 2026-02-27


Please apply directly through our system with:

* Your updated CV
* Availability to start the assignment


In the motivation, describe why you are suitable for this assignment - refer to previous consulting assignments, employment, education and personal qualities.

**Please note:** We do not accept any applications through mail. All applications have to be sent through the portal to be valid.

title: System Engineer for Automotive Android Platform
description:
If you want to shape the foundation of next-generation in-vehicle experiences – and see your system engineering expertise come alive in real machines – this could be your next step. We’re looking for a System Engineer who enjoys working between hardware and software, defining system requirements, and helping teams build world-class infotainment and operator-interface solutions.

**About us**
------------


CPAC Systems develops advanced control systems for marine and industrial applications. Since 1999, we’ve been turning complex operations into intuitive experiences. With 250 employees, a portfolio of 80+ patents and more than 500,000 delivered products per year, we drive innovation in everything from electrification to intelligent automation, always working at the intersection of safety, efficiency and user experience. As part of Volvo Group, our role is to lead advanced technology development and explore the next generation of smart control systems.

**Your role**
-------------


As a System Engineer, you will play an important role in defining and integrating complex infotainment systems. You’ll work where hardware, the Android platform and customer requirements meet, making sure everything fits together into a reliable, well-performing system.


You will define system architecture and technical requirements, coordinate integration across hardware and software, and support teams with system-level knowledge throughout the development process. You’ll work closely with developers, testers and customers to ensure high-quality, user-friendly solutions for marine and industrial applications.


This is a hands-on role where you will influence design, drive integration and turn technical requirements into production-ready systems.

**Responsibilities**
--------------------

* Define system architecture and technical requirements for infotainment ECUs and integrated systems based on customer and supplier needs
* Coordinate integration between hardware, the Android platform and middleware components
* Analyze and solve system-level issues across hardware and software
* Work closely with developers, testers and customers to secure high-quality, user-focused solutions
* Maintain system documentation and interface specifications

**Key qualifications**
----------------------

* Strong system thinking and the ability to understand complex technical setups
* Good understanding of infotainment systems and ECU architecture
* Experience with system-level design and integration in embedded environments
* Familiarity with Android/AOSP and Linux-based systems
* Knowledge of automotive communication protocols such as Ethernet, CAN and GMSL
* Ability to read logs, debug system-level issues and suggest solutions
* Fluent in English (Swedish is a great plus)

**Who you are**
---------------


You see complex systems as full of possibilities and enjoy working hands-on to understand how each part connects. You stay current in your field and willingly share your knowledge with others. You appreciate having responsibility from start to finish and are comfortable challenging assumptions to find smarter and more efficient solutions. With a solid understanding of both hardware and software, and how they interact, you bring clarity, solve problems and help turn ideas into reliable real-world systems.

**How to apply**
----------------


Submit your application today and feel free to reach out to Talent Partner Victoria Sahlberg at *Victoria.sahlberg@cpacsystems.se* if you have any questions. As part of our recruitment process, we conduct drug and alcohol testing as well as background checks.

title: C++ developer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.
   

  

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*
**Your Profile (Must-have Requirements)**
* Excellent teamwork skills and an eagerness to reach goals in a collaborative manner
* Solid knowledge of modern C++
* Experience and a strong drive in helping to design gameplay and its underlying systems and implementing quality-focused technical solutions to make those systems work
* Solid knowledge of engineering practices
* The ability to work with large cross-platform codebases and legacy code
* Passion for learning and sharing knowledge with your team and the organisation
* An interest in game


**Application deadline:** 
 17-02-2026
   

  

**About Us**
 We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.
   

  

 Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?
   

  

 We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.
   

  

 🌟 A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.
   

  

 🚗 Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.
   

  

 💼 Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.
   

  

 🌴 Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?
   

  

 🏥 Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.
   

  

 📚 Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.
   

  

 🕑 Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?
   

  

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Senior Android Software Engineer
description:
**Job Description**

 Are you passionate about creating impactful
 **Mobile experiences on Android** 
 ? We’re looking for a talented and motivated
 **Senior and Mid level Android Software Engineer** 
 to join our team and help shape the future of our mobile products.
   

  





 In this role, you’ll be at the heart of product development, collaborating closely with Product Managers, Engineering Managers, and cross-functional teams. You’ll play a key role in translating business needs into high-quality Android solutions, all while adhering to industry best practices and maintaining clean, scalable code.
   

  





**WHAT YOU’LL DO** 
  

  




* Design, develop, and maintain high-quality Android applications using Kotlin and/or Java.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, design, and deliver new features that enhance user experience.
* Write clean, efficient, and testable code following modern Android development best practices.
* Participate in code reviews, architecture discussions, and Agile ceremonies to ensure quality and alignment.
* Debug, troubleshoot, and optimize performance of existing applications to ensure reliability and responsiveness.
* Stay up to date with the latest Android trends, tools, and technologies, and apply them to improve development workflows.
* Ensure applications meet security standards and follow modern compliance practices.
* Contribute to improving internal development processes, tooling, and documentation for better team efficiency.



**WHO YOU’LL WORK WITH** 
  

  





 Our product teams are dedicated to building advanced internal tools that support data-driven decision-making across product development. We focus on analyzing test variations, interpreting performance data, and delivering insights that help product teams optimize feature rollouts. By collaborating closely with cross-functional teams, we ensure that new features are launched efficiently and effectively. Through continuous learning and iteration, we contribute to innovation and excellence in user experience across the organization.
   

  





**WHO YOU ARE**




 We are looking for people with...
   

  




* Professional experience in
 **Android development** 
 . Proficiency in Kotlin (Java is a plus).
* Experience with
 **Jetpack Compose** 
 .
* Solid understanding of Android SDK, Material Design, and Jetpack components.
* Experience working with RESTful APIs, third-party libraries, and JSON.
* Familiarity with Android architectural patterns (e.g., MVVM, Clean Architecture).
* Experience with version control systems, especially Git.
* Knowledge of dependency injection frameworks (e.g., Hilt, Dagger).
* Understanding mobile app performance, memory management, and debugging tools.
* Familiarity with testing frameworks (e.g., JUnit, Espresso).
* Ability to work in an agile development environment.



 Nice to Have
   

  




* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines for Android.
* Exposure to mobile analytics tools (e.g., Firebase, Mixpanel).
* Published apps in the Google Play Store.



 And people who have:
   

  




* **Problem-Solving Skills** 
 : A logical and creative mindset to tackle challenges and deliver effective solutions, even under pressure.
* **Collaborative Spirit** 
 : The ability to work seamlessly with cross-functional teams including designers, product managers, and backend developers.
* **Interpersonal Communication** 
 : A clear and thoughtful approach to articulating ideas, technical concepts, and feedback, both in writing and verbally.
* **Adaptability** 
 : Comfort with navigating change, learning new tools, and adjusting to evolving project needs.
* **Growth Mindset** 
 : Openness to feedback and a drive to continuously improve and grow professionally.



**WHO WE ARE** 
  

  





 H&M Group is a global company of strong fashion brands and ventures. Our goal is to prove that there is no compromise between exceptional design, affordable prices, and sustainable solutions. We want to liberate fashion for the many, and our customers are at the heart of every decision we make.
   

  





 We are made up of thousands of passionate and talented colleagues united by our shared culture and values. Together, we want to use our power, our scale, and our knowledge to push the fashion industry towards a more inclusive and sustainable future.
   

  





**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE** 
  

  





 At H&M Group, we are proud to be a vibrant and welcoming company. We offer our employees attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe.
   

  




* **Staff discount card** 
 : Usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online.
* **H&M Incentive Program (HIP)** 
 : Included in our HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
* **Competitive pensions** 
 : Collective Agreement and ITP pensions competitive to the Swedish market.
* **Generous vacation** 
 : 30 days' vacation, health care allowance, and good work-life balance.
* **Additional perks** 
 : Discounts from Benify.
* **Innovative Environment** 
 : Work with cutting-edge technology and innovative solutions.
* **Global Impact** 
 : Be part of a team that influences users worldwide.
* **Professional Growth** 
 : Endless opportunities to learn and develop your skills.
* **Collaborative Culture** 
 : Join a motivated team that values collaboration and excellence.



**JOIN US** 
  

  





 Our uniqueness comes from a combination of many things – our inclusive and collaborative culture, our strong values, and opportunities for growth. But most of all, it’s our people who make us who we are.
   

  





 This is a full-time permanent position, starting as soon as possible according to the agreement. The role is a hybrid position, based in our office in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  





 Apply by sending in your
 **CV in English** 
 as soon as possible. Due to data policies, we only accept applications through the career page.
   

  





 Take the next step in your career together with us. The journey starts here. We are eager to meet you!
   

  





 \*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.

title: Software Engineer, Android
description:
**About the Company** 




  





 At FDJ UNITED, we don't just follow the game, we reinvent it. FDJ UNITED is one of Europe’s leading betting and gaming operators, with a vast portfolio of iconic brands and a reputation for technological excellence. With more than 5,000 employees and a presence in around fifteen regulated markets, the Group offers a diversified, responsible range of games, both under exclusive rights and open to competition. We set new standards, proving that entertainment and safety can go hand in hand. Here, you’ll work alongside a team of passionate individuals dedicated to delivering the best and safest entertaining experiences for our customers every day. We’re looking for bold people who are eager to succeed and ready to level-up the game. If you thrive on innovation, embrace challenges, and want to make a real impact at all levels, FDJ UNITED is your playing field. Join us in shaping the future of gaming. Are you ready to LEVEL-UP THE GAME?
 



  





**About the Role** 




  





 We're looking for an Android Engineer with strong foundations in Kotlin and modern Android development, who is eager to learn, improve, and take the next steps in their engineering career.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




  





**Android Development & Craftsmanship** 




  




* Design and implement Android features using Kotlin and modern Android frameworks.
* Contribute to shared components and modules across multiple applications.
* Work with Jetpack Compose, Coroutines / Flow, and established architectural patterns.
* Follow and apply existing architectural guidelines while gradually contributing ideas for improvement.



  





**Ownership & Delivery** 




  




* Take ownership of features from development to release, with support from senior engineers.
* Collaborate in planning, estimation, and delivery of Android work.
* Help identify and fix bugs, performance issues, and technical debt.
* Participate in incident analysis and contribute to long-term improvements.



  





**Quality & Testing** 




  




* Write unit tests and UI tests for new and existing features.
* Follow team testing standards and help maintain a reliable test suite.
* Work closely with QA and other engineers to ensure high-quality releases.
* Learn and apply best practices around observability, stability, and performance.



  





**Collaboration & Growth** 




  




* Actively participate in code reviews, both giving and receiving constructive feedback.
* Collaborate closely with Product Owners, designers, and backend engineers.
* Learn from senior engineers through pairing, reviews, and technical discussions.
* Contribute to improving team practices, documentation, and ways of working.



  





**Qualifications** 




  





 Core Technical Skills
 



  




* Solid experience building Android applications using Kotlin.
* Hands-on experience with Jetpack Compose and Android Jetpack libraries.
* Understanding of common Android architectural patterns (e.g. MVVM, Clean Architecture).
* Experience writing unit tests and basic UI tests (Espresso or Compose).
* Familiarity with Android performance basics, debugging, and profiling tools.
* Experience integrating Android apps with backend APIs.
* Working knowledge of Gradle, Git, and CI/CD pipelines.



  





**Required Skills** 




  




* A strong willingness to learn and grow as an Android engineer.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team.
* Care for code quality, readability, and maintainability.
* Clear communication and openness to feedback.
* Comfortable working in an environment with shared ownership and responsibility.

title: Test engineer, Power Solutions
description:
**About Us**
 Scania Power Solutions is a business area developing and marketing products for a broad range of industrial and marine applications. The business is managed as a “company with in the company” based on synergies with the vehicle business. At technical development within Power Solutions we are responsible for development of future power systems including engines and electrified systems and their performance throughout the complete project and product lifecycle. The shift towards sustainable and electrified solutions is pioneering also in our business and we are committed to contribute to that future.
   

  

**The team**
 The test operations team are responsible for development testing and verification of all the products, Internal combustion engine or Electrified, at Power Solutions. The group has a wide range of responsibilities working both inhouse in test cells and out in the field in close collaboration with our customers and business units. We consist of Engineers and mechanics with a wide range of knowledge supporting each other to reach our goal. We also collaborate closely with the development engineers, sales, and service units at Power Solutions.
   

  

 Your role
   

  

 As a test engineer you’re responsible for planning and organising the testing together with development groups, sales organisations, business units and customers. You are working hands on setting up and running tests with diesel engines mainly in testbeds internally and externally but also in the field with customer machines. You are the first line speaking partner for all stakeholders. As the electrification field grows the role can come to include working with e-mobility as well.
   

  

**Your tasks**
* Organising and planning tests with all stakeholders
* Hands on work with setting up and running tests in test bed and in the field
* Analysing and presenting test data
* Support and run improvement work together with colleagues and cross functions to improve our ways of working


 The role contains both national and international business travel, normally 2-10 international trips per year.
   

  

**Your profile**
 To succeed as a test engineer you need to have good communication skills and organisational skills. You are able to take initiative and proactively seek the information needed for the tests. In testing we work with costly resources and/or we are working directly with customers with high expectations, this requires a good combination of flexibility and structure in your work. We see that you have a good technical knowledge and a willingness to learn, grow and develop together with us.
   

  

  

* Bachelors degree in engineering or similar work experience.
* Fluent in English and might also be in Swedish.
* Experience of working with diesel engines both practically and theoretically.
* Experience working in testbeds.
* Skilled with diagnostics, logging tools, measuring equipment and sensors.
* Experience working within electrification is a merit.


**Interested?**
 Great! Please help us understand why you should be our next colleague by providing us with your CV and a motivational letter with no later than 2026-02-28. Selection will be ongoing throughout the application time so don’t. A background check might be conducted for this position.
   

  

**For more information**
 Contact Gustav Leboeuf, Head of Test Operations, gustav.leboeuf@scania.com
   

  

 We are really looking forward to your application!

title: Senior Backendutvecklare till Handlarfinans
description:
Handlarfinans, ett helägt dotterbolag till Svea Bank, söker en senior backendutvecklare som vill vara med och vidareutveckla vårt affärskritiska kärnsystem. Hos oss får du en central roll i den tekniska organisationen och arbetar nära både produkt och verksamhet med fokus på stabila, säkra och skalbara lösningar.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Du blir en del av ett litet, erfaret team med stort eget ansvar och hög teknisk kompetens. Rollen innebär inget formellt personalansvar, men ett tydligt tekniskt ledarskap i det dagliga arbetet. Du arbetar hands-on med backendutveckling och är aktivt med och påverkar arkitektur, tekniska vägval och hur vi arbetar tillsammans.
   

  

 Vår plattform är en modern, molnbaserad SaaS-lösning anpassad för flera marknader och med höga krav på säkerhet, tillgänglighet och datakvalitet. Vi prioriterar långsiktig kvalitet och stabilitet framför snabba kompromisser.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter:**
* Backendutveckling i Python och SQL
* Utveckling och förvaltning av affärskritiska API:er
* Arbete med meddelandeinfrastruktur och systemintegrationer
* Bidra till arkitektur, kodstandarder och hög teknisk kvalitet
* Säkerställa hög säkerhet, stabil drift och god skalbarhet
* Samverka med andra team och bolag inom Svea-koncernen


**Vem är du?**
 Du har flera års erfarenhet av backendutveckling i affärskritiska system och trivs i en roll där du tar stort eget ansvar. Du är initiativtagande, lösningsorienterad och van att ta tekniskt ägarskap – både för kod, arkitektur och arbetssätt. Även om rollen inte är en chefsroll ser vi att du naturligt bidrar med ledarskap och stöd i teamet.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har:
   

  

* Mycket goda kunskaper i Python och SQL
* Stark förståelse för backendarkitektur och API-design
* Erfarenhet av meddelandeinfrastruktur och systemintegrationer
* Gärna erfarenhet av AWS eller annan molnplattform
* Erfarenhet av agila arbetssätt, gärna Scrum, samt verktyg som Jira
* Erfarenhet av säkerhetsnära utveckling (t.ex. autentisering och behörighet)


 Du har Universitetsutbildning inom systemvetenskap eller motsvarande samt tidigare arbetat inom bank, fintech eller annan reglerad bransch. För att lyckas i denna tjänst har också goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska. Arbete från kontoret i Solna sker minst tre dagar i veckan.
   

  

**Om Handlarfinans (dotterbolag till Svea Bank)**
 Handlarfinans är ett fintech-bolag som specialiserar sig på finansiella tjänster för bilhandlare i hela Norden. Vi digitaliserar och förenklar processen för lagerfinansiering och inköp av begagnade fordon och är en del av Svea Bank-koncernen.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via e-post. Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterare Ellen Hallengren på ellen.hallengren@svea.com.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Automationsingenjörer, AstraZeneca - Sweden Biomanufacturing Center (SBC), Södertälje
description:
Är du en självständig problemlösare som drivs av tekniska utmaningar och tvärfunktionellt samarbete? Vill du ta en ledande roll med stora utvecklingsmöjligheter, nära kärnverksamheten i ett av världens ledande läkemedelsföretag? Då kan Sweden Biomanufacturing Center (SBC) vara rätt plats för dig.
   

  

 SBC i Södertälje är en central del av AstraZenecas strategi för biologiska läkemedel och vår primära lanseringssite. Här arbetar vi i innovativa, högteknologiska miljöer där vi utvecklar och tillverkar biologiska läkemedel som förändrar liv. Vardagen präglas av stark laganda, coachande ledarskap och nyfikenhet. Tempot är högt, utvecklingsvägarna många och vi verkar hållbart – för varandra och för planeten.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder möjlighet att bli en del av Facilities, Engineering, SHE & Sustainability inom SBC. Funktionen ansvarar för OT Automation, investeringsprojekt, underhåll, fastighetsförvaltning samt SHE och hållbarhet.
   

  

 Vi söker nu automationsingenjörer till teamet OT Automation SBC. Arbetstiden är förlagd till dagtid.
   

  

**Din Spelplan**
 SBC OT Automation ansvarar för teknisk support till produktionsanläggningarna i Södertälje och driver service-, underhålls- och utvecklingsarbete. Du får en avgörande roll i att säkerställa hög teknisk tillgänglighet i våra anläggningar – en utmärkt möjlighet för dig med starkt teknikintresse, särskilt inom styrsystem, som vill bidra i ett engagerat team med fokus på ständig utveckling och förbättring.
   

  

**Din Roll**
 Du kommer att arbeta i en grupp med fokus på industriell IT, automation samt styr- och reglerteknik. Som automationsingenjör hos oss fungerar du som tekniskt stöd till underhållsorganisationen genom att utföra avhjälpande och förebyggande underhåll på våra automatiserade system och processer samt vara drivande i framtida utvecklingsprojekt.
   

  

**Dina Huvudsakliga Arbetsuppgifter Inkluderar Bland Annat**
* Felsöka, förbättra och optimera automations- och styrsystem.
* Modifiera och utveckla funktioner i befintliga styrsystem.
* Felsöka och åtgärda fältbusskommunikation (t.ex. Profibus, Profinet, Modbus).
* Installera och testa automationslösningar i nya eller befintliga miljöer.
* Delta i driftsättning och kvalificering av ny utrustning.
* Medverka i förbättringsarbete och projekt.
* Medverka vid myndighetsinspektioner och besiktningar.


**Kvalifikationer**
 Du har en högskoleutbildning alternativt så har du förvärvat motsvarande kompetens genom mångårigt arbete. Din tekniska kompetens inom automationsområdet är bred och du har minst 3 års tidigare erfarenhet med arbete inom Automation - Industriell IT (OT).
   

  

 Då vi är ett internationellt företag förutsätts att du obehindrat kan uttrycka dig både på
 **svenska** 
 och
 **engelska** 
 i tal och skrift.
   

  

**Teknisk Erfarenhet Vi Ser Gärna Att Du Har**
* PLC-plattformar (t.ex Siemens STEP7 Classic, Siemens TIA Portal, B&R Automation Studio).
* SCADA/HMI (t.ex. InTouch, WinCC, iFIX).
* Motion/drives (t.ex. SIMOTION/SINAMICS, Beckhoff, B&R).
* Robotik (t.ex. KUKA, Stäubli).
* Databaser (t.ex. SQL Server, PostgreSQL).


**Meriterande**
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet inom el och elkonstruktion.
* Erfarenhet av GMP (Good Manufacturing Practice) och processindustri.


**Framgångsfaktorer**
 Drivande och samarbetsinriktad ingenjör med stark analytisk förmåga. Van att arbeta självständigt och i team, bygger goda relationer och tar initiativ i högt tempo. Erfarenhet av GMP och processindustri är meriterande. För denna roll krävs även B-körkort, då beredskap kan komma att ingå.
   

  

**Kärnkompetenser**
 Du är analytisk och lösningsorienterad och tar dig an komplexa problem på ett effektivt sätt. Samtidigt arbetar du noggrant och med starkt säkerhetsfokus, särskilt när tekniken måste fungera utan avbrott. Du är kommunikativ och van vid att samarbeta med många olika roller och intressenter. Ditt teknikintresse gör att du kontinuerligt följer utvecklingen inom industrin och digitalisering. Du är dessutom flexibel och ansvarstagande, och kan växla mellan långsiktiga projekt och akuta insatser när det behövs.
   

  

 Det här är en roll för dig som gillar att kombinera teknik med funktion och göra skillnad i praktiken.
   

  

**Varför AstraZeneca?**
 När vi ser chansen att förändras tar vi den. Varje möjlighet, oavsett hur liten, kan vara början på något stort. Att leverera mediciner som förändrar människors liv handlar om entreprenörsanda, att se ögonblicken och förstå deras potential. Hos oss trivs du som vill arbeta både självständigt och i team. Genom ditt arbete bidrar du varje dag till att produktionen av livsviktiga läkemedel kan fortlöpa.
   

  

 Vi värdesätter din kommunikativa förmåga, din analytiska skicklighet och ditt driv att få saker gjorda. Din vana vid högt tempo och din anpassningsförmåga i en föränderlig miljö kommer väl till pass hos oss. Här får du utlopp för ditt intresse för teknik, styrsystem och underhåll.
   

  

 Funderar du på hur det skulle vara att bli en del av vårt team i Södertälje? Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Ansökan Och Kontakt**
* För frågor om tjänsten: kontakta ansvarig rekryterare Axel Lindberg axel.lindberg1@astrazeneca.com
* Sista ansökningsdag: 23 februari 2026. Intervjuer kan hållas löpande under ansökningstiden.


 Information om våra förmåner, bonus, semesterdagar m.m. hittar du här: https://bit.ly/AstraZenecaBenefitsSWE
   

  

**Mer Information Om Sweden Biomanufacturing Center**
* Sweden Biologics Center
* Sweden Biologics Center - what we do
* Sweden Biologics Center - Who we are


**Date Posted**
 09-feb.-2026
   

  

**Closing Date**
 23-feb.-2026
   

  

 Our mission is to build an inclusive and equitable environment. We want people to feel they belong at AstraZeneca and Alexion, starting with our recruitment process. We welcome and consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of characteristics. We offer reasonable adjustments/accommodations to help all candidates to perform at their best. If you have a need for any adjustments/accommodations, please complete the section in the application form.

title: Production Engineer - Pharma
description:
At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world’s most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.
   

  

**Your Role**
 We are looking for a Production Engineer for our pharmaceutical projects in Stockholm
   

  

*In this role you will play a key role in:*
* Operating independently within your area of expertise and lead others while driving competence development.
* Investigating deviations, support production technical issues, and contribute to improvement projects.
* Manage tasks such as issuing recipes and batch records, coordinating installations, or producing plant layouts and detailed designs.
* Lead or participate in subprojects related to process engineering, automation, or plant design.
* Ensure quality and documentation compliance according to given guidelines.


**Your Profile**
* Master’s or bachelor’s degree in science (or equivalent).
* Process development and technology with experience from Process technology, Automation, Facility project planning (Mechanical and Production technology)
* Strong technical proficiency in Process Engineering, Automation, Plant Design, or Project Management.
* Ability to work autonomously and deliver results based on guidelines while assuring quality.
* Experience in leading small projects or subprojects and collaborating across functions such as plant engineers and design engineers.
* Good communication and problem-solving skills to support production and improvement initiatives.


**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
* We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
* At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* We support your personal development and offer an education library with more than 250 000 (!) courses and educations and certifications.


**Application**
 As part of our recruitment process, identity verification or background checks may occasionally be conducted.
   

  

 Valid work permit for Sweden is required.
   

  

 Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem.

title: Product Manager
description:
**About Magma Math** 

 Magma is one of the world’s fastest-growing and most celebrated EdTech companies, transforming math education through the power of AI. Our platform turns handwritten solutions into digital insights, empowering teachers to focus on creativity and deeper learning — while giving them real-time visibility into student progress.
 



 The result? More inclusive, engaging, and effective math classrooms for all learners.
 



 But we’re not just building better tools. We’re tackling one of the biggest challenges in global education: math underperformance. With 1 in 5 students globally struggling in math — a subject that forms the backbone of so many career paths — we believe the opportunity to improve outcomes at scale is massive.
 



 We’re already the go-to solution in thousands of schools — and we’re just getting started. As we expand rapidly across the U.S. and Europe, we’re building a team as ambitious as our mission: to help millions of students unlock their full potential in math.
 


**The Role** 

 The Product & Tech team at Magma is divided into three core experiences: Teacher, Student and District. With a growing user base (and plenty of exciting problems to solve), we’re now hiring Product Managers to strengthen both the Teacher Experience team and the District Experience team.
 



 In this role, you will work closely with a team of developers, QA and designers to plan, build and launch new features within one of these experiences. You will own a domain end-to-end - from figuring out what problem is worth solving, to shipping a solution, to making sure it actually creates value for students, teachers, districts and the business.‍
 



**Who you are and what you know** 




 To succeed in the role you need to:
 


* Be hands-ons and contribute across full product development phase; user research, design, implementation, testing. This is not a pure project manager role where you are only coordinating
* Be comfortable owning both business and tech outcomes
* Be curious and ready to learn a lot of new things



 Your responsibilities will include:
 


* Leading a team of developers, QAs and designers
* Leading the development and implementation of a domain within Teacher or District Experience.
* Coordinating efforts across the product, tech, customer success and revenue teams.



**Requirements** 



* Hungry to grow within Product Development and track record of ability to go deep/obsess over projects you've run
* Engineering degree (or equivalent) from top tier university
* Startup experience - you know what you are getting yourself into!
* Experience of fast paced and high performance environment



**Nice to have** 



* Experience as software engineer, designer, product manager, data science
* Experience in edtech or education
* Portfolio of products you've built


**What we offer** 
* Build and ship high touch products with positive impact million of users
* Be part of driving change in an industry
* Fantastic colleagues in a fun environment with great opportunities to learn
* Competitive remuneration & benefit package
* Annual company trip
* An opportunity to work on a meaningful mission and have an exceptional impact on education, society and how children learn math across the world
   

 ‍



**Start** 
 : As soon as possible
 



**Office location** 
 : 
 



**Our recruitment process (all in office):** 




 1st interview with Hiring Manager and Head of People 
 



 2nd interview with Hiring Manager and Magma member
 



 3rd interview with Founders and Magma member

title: Global Internship Program Industrial Technique Business Area - Embedded Software Commercialization
description:
Global Internship Program
   

  

 Want to gain global experience and make a real impact in software commercialization? Our Global Internship Program gives you the best of both worlds - a global project and a local internship.
   

  

**As a participant you’ll be part of a global project** 
 within the
 **Industrial Technique Business Area,** 
 where you join a diverse group of talented students from around the world to collaborate virtually on a business challenge together, tackling real challenges that impact our business. You’ll also take part in exclusive learning sessions with senior leaders, both virtually and on-site and receive mentorship and access to internal training programs to accelerate your professional growth.
   

  

 Parallel to the global activities, you will work part-time during the academic year and full-time during the summer within Embedded Software Commercialization at Atlas Copco Industrial Technique Business Area.
 **In this role you will explore the future of software as a service. You’ll assess the feasibility of offering Atlas Copco’s control-unit software as a service (SaaS) solution, benchmark competitors, and manage international interactions with key automotive customers. Experience from similar projects in industries like fintech is a plus.** 
 This is your chance to take an exciting insight in working with embedded software commercialization while developing skills that will boost your career.
   

  

 On top of this you’ll have the opportunity to write a
 **master’s thesis in spring 2027** 
 with Atlas Copco Group.
   

  

 To succeed, you will need
   

  

* You’re in your 4th year at a Swedish university, preferably in Engineering, Industrial Economics, Supply Chain Management, Data Science, or Sustainability
* You plan to write your master’s thesis in spring 2027.
* You communicate fluently in English.
* You’re curious, proactive, and motivated
* Available to work full-time in summer and approx. 10–20 hours/week during spring and autumn.
* You live in the Stockholm region and can work partly on-site at our headquarters in Sickla, Nacka.


 In return, we offer
   

  

* A unique mix of global collaboration and local responsibility.
* Practical experience at Atlas Copco Group while completing your studies.
* Build an international network and gain insights into how a global industrial leader operates.
* Professional training and personal coaching.
* The chance to write your master’s thesis in an international environment.
* Insights to cross functional teams such as R&D, Marketing, and Operations.
* Hourly compensation during the internship.


 Atlas Copco Group, Industrial Technique Business Area is operating globally on all continents, yet we are known for our collaborative and entrepreneurial spirit. We value diversity and inclusion and encourage cross-border teamwork. Innovation is at the heart of everything we do, and we strive to continuously improve to meet our customers’ needs. If you are looking for a culture where you can learn, grow, and make an impact, this is the place for you.
   

  

 Job location
   

  

 Nacka, Sweden
   

  

 Contact information
   

  

 We are collaborating with WeSelect in this recruitment, Nina Dahl will be your first contact and happy to support you on your application journey for this internship program. We look forward to meet you in the interview phase!
   

  

**Ready to shape a more sustainable future?**
 Apply now and join Atlas Copco Group’s Global Internship Program for the Industrial Technique Business Area!
   

  

 Explore all avaliable openings and learn more about the Global Internship Program at our career page: https://www.atlascopcogroup.com/en/careers/student-opportunities/global-internship-program/available-internships
   

  

**Uniting curious minds**
 Behind every innovative solution, there are people working together to transform the future. With careers sparked by initiative and lifelong learning, we unite curious minds, and you could be one of them.
